column5: I've been meaning to post this all week but finally had some time this evening.  Last weekend as a surprise for our wedding anniversary and my birthday, my wife surprised me with a trip to Las Vegas.  We really couldn't afford it but since we've been married this is only the second time we've ever been away alone since the kids have been born. We're not big gamblers so we did a lot of sight seeing and took this one day trip of a lifetime.  We took an ATV ride through the Valley of Fire State Park.  It was a 28 mile track and alot of fun.  For the three days we were there the weather was 108, 104 and 100 degrees respectively.  The thing there is that there is no humidity which is awesome.  It's still plenty warm but without the humidity its alot more bearable.  Anyways here's some pics of the ATV ride of a lifetime...  Getting ready to go..     This is the vehicle we followed which had our lunch and water in it...   The start of some of the awesome scenery...This is where they filmed the desert scenes in the Star Wars trilogy.  We're also near the famous Area 51!!    Our first rest stop.  Tom (the tour guide) showing Sue some of the animals and plants that are in the desert.        I had 5 bottles of water on the trip which lasted 3 1/2 hours, never even had to pee once.   A stop in a valley.....         We stopped for lunch in a nice shaded spot...   While we were having lunch, a pack of desert mountain goats appeared in the mountain ahead of us !!!   A truly awesome day I will remember for the rest of my life.     If you ever head to Vegas, I'd highly recommend trying this.  At a $150, it's a bargain.  Jim
